CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 15, 1955, pg. 11, reads: "Rev, and Mrs. B. J. Small...in stunning wedding." Accompanying article reads: "Noted Gospel Singer - Mary Johnson Davis Marries Rev. Small of Quakertowne - in soft glow of candlelight, Mary Johnson Davis of Pittsburgh became the bride of the Rev. B. J. Small of Philadelphia, Pa., at Macedonia Baptist Church, Sunday, Oct. 2.  The Rev. William J. Harvey III performed the ceremony.  The bride chose and ice blue chapel gown of imported lace and brocade satin with a heart shaped head gear of the same material, blue nylon lace shoes, and carried an orchid crowned Bible.  Members of the bride's family who were part of the ceremony were her daughter, Mrs. Elizabeth Cocrel, matron of honor; her sister, Mrs. Bernice Johnson; her cousin, Mrs. Edmonia Stevens, bridesmaids, and Henry White Jr., cousin of the bride, who was ring bearer.  Fields Johnson Jr., brother of the bride, gave her in marriage. Other in the party were Jacqueline Williams, flower girl, and Eugene Glenn, best man. The wedding music featured Juanita Woods, soloist; Joseph Lee Jr., organist, and the Gould Singers.  A capacity crowd attended both the ceremony and the reception which followed immediately in the church dining hall.  Out-of-town guests present were Hannah Williams and Mother Walker of Washington, D. C.; Mrs. Delores Keys, Evelyn Killens and Doris Henry of Philadelphia, Pa., Mrs. and Mrs. Wendell Stewart of Cleveland, Ohio; Cynthia Martin and Mrs. James Marks of Altoona, Pa.; Mmes. Andrea Cobbs and Velma Till of Newark, N. J.   The bride will be remembered as one of Pittsburgh's prominent gospel singers.  The groom is the pastor of St. John Baptist Church in Philadelphia where the newlyweds will reside.  Mrs. Lelia Lee directed the wedding."
TitMainTitle: Bride Mary Johnson Davis Small and groom Rev. B. J. Small, walking down steps in Macedonia Baptist Church
